attributes.title: Burnie's Crazy Dream, Part 1
attributes.description: In RTAA #128, Burnie talks about a crazy dream he had wherein Lindsay becomes invisible in her wedding dress and fights the Polish army. Sounds legit.

attributes.title: Burnie's Crazy Dream, Part 2
attributes.description: In RTAA #129, Burnie's epic dream concludes with Lindsay facing off with the leader of the Polish army, but he's unlike any foe she's met so far. Meanwhile, Michael deals with the fallout of his bride-to-be disappearing. Will they have a happy ending

attributes.title: Gus' Candy Cane-ine
attributes.description: In RTAA #130, it's Gus' turn to have a crazy dream. He discovers his neighbor is the former head coach of University of Texas football team, and his dog is really a Christmas treat.

attributes.title: Lazer Tag Tales
attributes.description: In RTAA #131, the gang plays lazer tag, and things get intense as Michael and Lindsay are pitted against one another. Can love bloom even on a battlefield

attributes.title: Gus' Gas Problem
attributes.description: In RTAA #132, when a mix-up with the gas company cancels his service, Gus must take matters into his own hands to set things straight. Angry Gus takes no prisoners!

attributes.title: Workspace & Cavemen
attributes.description: In RTAA #133, at the old office, Burnie finally gets his computer back when Gavin goes back to England, but suddenly everyone wants to use it. Then, Burnie tries to explain how muting a user on Twitter works to a caveman.

attributes.title: Sewers & Freezers
attributes.description: In RTAA #134, Burnie talks about exploring the sewers as a kid, and one time in particular when it became an Indiana Jones adventure. Then, he recalls the time in college some random dudes dropped a freezer on his lawn.

attributes.title: Kung Shu Wedding
attributes.description: In RTAA #135, Gus goes to a wedding, but ends up having to take care of Drunk Esther and gets groped by one of her relatives. Burnie and Gavin talk about their shoe-based fighting style called Kung Shu

attributes.title: The One in the Hole
attributes.description: In RTAA #136, Michael goes on a stealth mission in the middle of a Let's Play to free Ryan's "pet" cow Edgar from imprisonment. Will his plan succeed

attributes.title: Michael's Weird Neighbor
attributes.description: In RTAA #137, Michael gets a knock on his door from someone down the hall who needs to call the police. But as the neighbor explains his story on the phone, Michael realizes maybe he is slightly insane.

attributes.title: Bad Luck Burnie Rides Again
attributes.description: In RTAA #138, Burnie sees a couple having an argument outside his apartments, and, once again trying to be a nice guy, tries to break it up. But the situation is more complex than he was anticipating.

attributes.title: Speeding and Dreaming
attributes.description: In RTAA #139, Burnie tells the story of his kid finding a speeding ticket, and the ensuing shakedown he got as a result. Then, Gavin has another lucid dream, this time involving his family and gems.

attributes.title: A Staircase of Assault
attributes.description: In RTAA #140, Miles pushes his little brother down the stairs, then thinks of a way to not get blamed for it.

attributes.title: Matt Wants Fanfare
attributes.description: In RTAA #141, Matt is disappointed with the lack of fanfare with his lunch.

attributes.title: Curses, Cookies, & Atoms
attributes.description: In RTAA #142, Chris curses a baby, Jack eats some cookies, and Burnie smashes some atoms.

attributes.title: Dan Drinks, Gavin Hoodwinks
attributes.description: In RTAA #143, Dan orders a bunch of girly drinks at dinner, thinking they are free. Gus and Gavin re-enact an internet conversation he had with a girl.

attributes.title: The Shock Bus
attributes.description: In RTAA #144, Burnie talks about a shocking game he would play with locals south of the border, and why he one time spontaneously flipped the bird at a school bus.

attributes.title: Miles & The Mouse Mishmash
attributes.description: In RTAA #145, when it's discovered a mouse has taken residence in his apartment, Miles and his roommates try to catch it.

attributes.title: Burnie's Neighbor Encounter
attributes.description: In RTAA #146, Burnie shows Matt around his neighborhood, but Matt doesn't have nice things to say about his neighbor's house

attributes.title: Hope vs. Starvation
attributes.description: In RTAA #147, Gavin wonders if the hope of food can stave off starving to death.

attributes.title: Old Geoff, New Suit
attributes.description: In RTAA #148, Millie worries that Geoff is getting too old, and Gus tries to buy a suit.

attributes.title: Gus the Social Media Hostage
attributes.description: In RTAA #149, Gus rents a storage unit, but the employees force him to write a review about them on Google Maps.

attributes.title: Behind the Blue
attributes.description: In RTAA #150, Burnie encounters problems on the set of Animated Adventures.

attributes.title: Grand Theft Cola
attributes.description: In RTAA #151, Brandon learns a lesson about hot cars and soda cans, and Miles and Gus try to play a game of golf in GTA Online.

attributes.title: Burnie's Wedding Pranks
attributes.description: In RTAA #152, Burnie talks about some pranks he tried to pull during Michael and Lindsay's wedding.

attributes.title: Long Title, Weird Girl
attributes.description: In RTAA #153, Burnie talks about the ridiculous panel name he and Gus came up with, and Geoff talks about an old girlfriend who had strange characteristics.

attributes.title: Gavin or Google #1: Breaking Babies
attributes.description: In RTAA #154, Burnie and the gang play "Gavin or Google," the guessing game sweeping the Internet. Burnie gives a short phrase to both Gavin and the Google search engine, and Barbara and Gus must guess who returned which phrase, Gavin or Google

attributes.title: Behind the Blue Outtakes
attributes.description: Check out alternate takes and deleted dialogue from the RTAA #150, "Behind the Blue." Lock up your panther and enjoy these great outtakes!

attributes.title: Bound 4 (Implicit)
attributes.description: Parody of Seth Rogen and James Franco's parody of Kanye West's Bound 2, first shown at RTX 2014.

attributes.title: Technical Bully Problems
attributes.description: In RTAA #155, Joel has another technical issue that Burnie tries to help with. Burnie talks about a kid who confronts a bully with an surprising outcome.

attributes.title: Canadian Zombie Property
attributes.description: In RTAA #156, the guys discuss some changes in direction that could have ruined Dead Rising 2, Burnie finds a familiar looking rock, and Gus tells people to get off his lawn.

attributes.title: Godzilla vs The Human Bugs
attributes.description: In RTAA #157, the guys wonder what it would be like if Godzilla were as grossed out by humans as humans are by bugs.

attributes.title: Geoff's Weird Dreams
attributes.description: In RTAA #158, Geoff tells the gang about two strange dreams he had, one involving drunk gaming, and the other leading to an accident in his pants.

attributes.title: Stealin' Cable With Geoff
attributes.description: In RTAA #159, young Geoff almost gets caught stealing cable with his friend in Tennessee.

attributes.title: Stealin' Cable With Michael
attributes.description: In RTAA #160, Michael shares his cable theft story, which led to a profitable business on the side.

attributes.title: Miles Hacks the System
attributes.description: In RTAA #161, a simple misunderstanding turns into a security breach scare at the office.

attributes.title: Walk-ins & Dead Bodies
attributes.description: In RTAA #162, a broken lock on the bathroom door leads to an awkward encounter for Gus. Joel talks about a friend who specialized in portraying dead bodies.

attributes.title: Brandon's George Foreman Grill
attributes.description: In RTAA #163, Brandon brags about his new George Foreman grill.

attributes.title: The Snail Assassin
attributes.description: In RTAA #164, in one of his strangest hypothetical scenarios ever, Gavin wonders what it would be like if you were constantly chased by a snail with a deadly touch.

attributes.title: Gus The Destroyer
attributes.description: In RTAA #165, Gus gets drunk in a hot tub then destroys someone's creation.

attributes.title: Pilot Football Message
attributes.description: In RTAA #166, Gus wants to be a secret pilot, Burnie talks about Rice University's football team, and sends a heartwarming text to Gavin. Audio from RT Podcasts: Secret Pilot - Podcast #28, Rice's Football Team - Podcast #13, Burnie's Message - Podcast #231

attributes.title: Chris' Doot-Doot, Blaine's Duster
attributes.description: in RTAA #167, Chris talks about his bathroom habits, and Blaine tries to look cool during an apocalypse. Audio from RT Podcast #287 and #236

attributes.title: Gavin or Google #2: Dog Door Bells
attributes.description: In RTAA #168, the gang plays Gavin or Google again, this time concerning dogs.
attributes.display_title: 2014:E44 - Gavin or Google #2: Dog Door Bells

attributes.title: A Selfie With Burnie
attributes.description: In RTAA #169, a fan tries to take a selfie with Burnie at RTX, but is constantly interrupted.

attributes.title: The Greatest Episode Ever
attributes.description: Jordan goes out of town, so Burnie improvises this week's RTAA.

attributes.title: RTAA Classics With Commentary 2 - Omnibus Station
attributes.description: Join the cast and crew of Rooster Teeth as they watch and discuss some of their favorite Rooster Teeth Animated Adventures. This time, Gavin and Michael join in on watching and discussing some of the omnibus episodes.
attributes.display_title: 2014:E47 - RTAA Classics With Commentary 2 - Omnibus Station

attributes.title: Geoff's Flirty Drive
attributes.description: Geoff tells the tale of how he and his friends put some smooth moves on a couple of fellow high school girls.

attributes.title: Lost Bugs & Stolen Balls
attributes.description: Burnie wonders about what it's like for bugs to get lost, and Geoff steals a ball from Caleb.

attributes.title: Joel's Theatrical Sickness
attributes.description: In RTAA #172, Joel starts feeling deathly sick in a movie theater, and Gavin almost cares.
